title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, North-western, Northern, and North Central Provinces, and in Galle, Matara, and Trincomalee Districts.

title: Trump will meet Xi in South Korea, says White House
byline: US President Donald Trump will meet his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping in South Korea on 30 October on the sidelines of a summit in Asia, the White House has confirmed.

title: Thailand’s Queen Mother Sirikit, influential style icon, dies at 93
byline: Thailand’s Queen Mother Sirikit, who brought glamour and elegance to a postwar revival in the country’s monarchy and who, in later years, would occasionally wade into politics, has died aged 93, the Thai Royal Household Bureau said on Saturday.

title: Fire breaks out on ‘Rajarata Rejini’ train
byline: A fire has broken out on the ‘Rajarata Rejini’ train operating from Anuradhapura to Beliatta, the Railway Department reported.

title: Kalu Ganga water level rises; Residents urged to be vigilant
byline: The Department of Irrigation reports that the water levels in several reservoirs across the country have further increased due to the ongoing heavy rainfall.

title: Baddegama PS deputy chairman hospitalized after attack
byline: The Deputy Chairman of the Baddegama Pradeshiya Sabha, Saman C. Liyanage, has reportedly been hospitalized following an attack by unidentified assailants.

title: Sri Lanka forms panel after Thailand raises concern over health of gifted elephants
byline: Sri Lanka has appointed a committee of veterinarians to examine two elephants gifted by Thailand, following concerns raised by Bangkok over their health condition, officials said on Saturday.

title: Nationwide tsunami mock drill scheduled for Nov. 5 – DMC
byline: The Director General of the Disaster Management Center (DMC), Major General (Retd.) Sampath Kotuwegoda, announced that preparations are underway for a tsunami mock exercise covering the entire island on November 5.

title: Private company LTL summoned before COPE committee
byline: Lanka Transformers Limited (LTL) was summoned before the Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) yesterday to provide information related to the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB).

title: Energy Minister orders withdrawal of PSRS Director General appointment letter
byline: The Minister of Energy, Eng. Kumara Jayakody, has directed the immediate withdrawal of a recent letter concerning the appointment of the Director General of the Power Sector Reforms Secretariat (PSRS).

title: 15 reservoirs spilling due to heavy rainfall
byline: The Irrigation Department reports that about 15 small and large reservoirs are spilling due to the ongoing heavy rainfall.

title: Minor flood warnings issued for several areas of Kalu Ganga basin
byline: The Department of Irrigation has warned that there is a risk of minor flooding in several areas along the Kalu Ganga basin during the next 48 hours.

title: SLNS Samudura dispatched to rescue crew of distressed merchant vessel
byline: The Sri Lanka Naval Ship (SLNS) Samudura departed yesterday (24) to rescue the crew of the MV Integrity Star, a merchant vessel that was in distress due to a mechanical malfunction in its main machinery nearly 100 nautical miles south of Sri Lanka.

title: Picasso painting held in private collection sells for $31 million at Paris auction
byline: A painting by Spanish artist Pablo Picasso, believed to be depicting his muse and partner Dora Maar, fetched 27 million euros ($31.49 million) at a Paris auction on Friday.

title: Thai PM to meet with Trump before signing Cambodia ceasefire deal
byline: Thailand’s prime minister will travel to Malaysia on Saturday to sign a ceasefire deal with Cambodia and meet with U.S. President Donald Trump, but will cut short his attendance at the ASEAN Summit there due to the death of the Thai Queen Mother Sirikit.

title: Gazette issued regarding release of vehicles stuck in customs
byline: A Gazette notification has been issued stipulating regulations for the release of vehicles held by Sri Lanka Customs.

title: Three more medals for Sri Lanka at South Asian Athletics Championships 2025
byline: Sri Lankan athletes added three more medals to Sri Lanka’s overall medals tally on day two of the 4th SAAF South Asian Senior Athletics Championships 2025 in Ranchi on Saturday.

title: Sri Lanka men and women storm to 4x100m relay gold in Ranchi
byline: Sri Lanka dominated the relays at the 4th South Asian Senior Athletics Championships 2025 in Ranchi, India winning gold in both the Men’s and Women’s 4x100m relay events.

title: China reports magnitude 5.5 earthquake in province near N. Korea
byline: China on Saturday reported a magnitude 5.5 earthquake in Jilin, a province that shares a border with North Korea, the official Xinhua news agency reported.

title: Police fire at van near checkpoint in Ratmalana, driver arrested
byline: Police officers engaged in duties at a routine police checkpoint near the Golumadama Junction in Ratmalana have given chase and opened fire at a vehicle that failed to comply with instruction to stop.
